required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validation and Refinement of Noninvasive Diagnostic Biomarkers for Endometriosis, The ENDOmarker Protocol
clinical_study.official_title: Validation and Refinement of Noninvasive Diagnostic Biomarkers for Endometriosis, The ENDOmarker Protocol

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

brief_summary.textblock: This study involves the prospective collection of endometrial biopsy tissue, serum, plasma, whole blood for DNA extraction, and urine from women who will be diagnosed as having (or not having) endometriosis at the time of scheduled surgery. The investigators plan to enroll approximately 500 women to validate and optimize the use of genomic classifiers alone or in combination with serum markers (such as cytokines) as a non-surgical marker of disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Collection of up to 3 2cm samples of Endometrial Tissue
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 collection timepoints: baseline and up to 18 weeks following surgery.
primary_outcome.description: Up to 3 2cm samples will be collected per collection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Collection of Serum 1 will be 2 10ml serum tubes of serum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 collection timepoints: baseline, up to 14 days following surgery and up to 18 weeks following surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: 2 10ml serum tubes will be drawn at each collection, up to 10 1.0ml aliquots per collection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Collection of Serum 2 will be 2 7 ml serum tubes of serum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 collection timepoints: baseline, up to 14 days following surgery and up to 18 weeks following surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: 2 7ml serum tubes drawn at each collection, up to 10 1.0ml aliquots of serum plus 1 15ml conical tube with the 2 blood clots per collection.

other_outcome.measure: Collection of Plasma in 1 4ml EDTA tube
other_outcome.time_frame: 3 collection timepoints: baseline, up to 14 days following surgery and up to 18 weeks following surgery.
other_outcome.description: 1 4ml EDTA tube will be drawn at each collection, up to 3 1.0ml aliquots per collection.

other_outcome.measure: Collection of Whole Blood in 2 4ml EDTA tubes
other_outcome.time_frame: 3 collection timepoints: baseline, up to 14 days following surgery and up to 18 weeks following surgery.
other_outcome.description: 2 4ml EDTA tubes will be drawn at each collection, up to 2 4.5ml aliquots as well as 1 FTA blood spot collection card per collection.

other_outcome.measure: Collection of Urine will be one complete sample as produced by the subject
other_outcome.time_frame: 3 collection timepoints: baseline, up to 14 days following surgery and up to 18 weeks following surgery.
other_outcome.description: 1 urine sample will be collected each time, up to 6 15ml aliquots and 5 1.5ml aliquots per collection will be taken.

biospec_descr.textblock: Collection of endometrial biopsy tissue, serum, plasma, whole blood for DNA extraction and urine

study_pop.textblock: Females aged 18-44 who are scheduled to undergo gynecologic surgery (laparoscopy/laparotomy). Indications for surgery can include: infertility, endometriosis, tubal ligation, lysis of adhesions, pelvic pain, hysterectomy (for benign condition), myomectomy, salpingo-oophorectomy, cystectomy, or diagnostic laparoscopy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- â€¢ Currently pregnant
- Current or past diagnosis of any malignancy (with the exception of non-melanoma skin cancer)
- Known to be HIV-positive
- Unable to give informed consent
- Unwillingness to have samples banked in Repository for future use
- Clinical evidence of active cervical infection
- Lupron (or other GRH agonist) therapy within the last 2 months (or Depo-Lupron within the last 4 months)
- Current use of estrogen or progestin (oral, transdermal, intrauterine or ring).
o Current use is defined as use in the index menstrual cycle (since the onset of the last menstrual period).
- Use of depo estrogen or progestin in last 3 months
- Current use of aromatase inhibitor
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women aged 18-44 scheduled to undergo gynecologic surgery (laparoscopy/laparotomy).
Indication for surgery can include: infertility, endometriosis, tubal ligation, lysis of adhesions, pelvic pain, hysterectomy (for benign condition), myomectomy, salpingo-oophorectomy, cystectomy, or diagnostic laparoscopy.

overall_official.affiliation: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)
